trans-unit.source: Guidelines
trans-unit.target: Guidelines

trans-unit.source: Developers will be reading your documents to learn .NET core, and to use it in their regular work.
trans-unit.target: Developers will be reading your documents to learn .NET core, and to use it in their regular work.

trans-unit.source: Your goal is to create useful documentation that helps the reader on their journey.
trans-unit.target: Your goal is to create useful documentation that helps the reader on their journey.

trans-unit.source: Our guidelines help with that.
trans-unit.target: Our guidelines help with that.

trans-unit.source: Our style guide contains four recommendations:
trans-unit.target: Our style guide contains four recommendations:

trans-unit.source: Use a Conversational Tone
trans-unit.target: Use a Conversational Tone

trans-unit.source: Write in 2nd Person
trans-unit.target: Write in 2nd Person

trans-unit.source: Use Active Voice
trans-unit.target: Use Active Voice

trans-unit.source: Target a 5th Grade Reading Level
trans-unit.target: Target a 5th Grade Reading Level

trans-unit.source: You will see examples of each of these as you read this style guide.
trans-unit.target: You will see examples of each of these as you read this style guide.

trans-unit.source: We've written this guide following our guidelines to provide examples for you to follow as you build documentation for .NET core.
trans-unit.target: We've written this guide following our guidelines to provide examples for you to follow as you build documentation for .NET core.

trans-unit.source: We also provide contrasting samples so you can see what articles look like when you don't follow our guidelines.
trans-unit.target: We also provide contrasting samples so you can see what articles look like when you don't follow our guidelines.

trans-unit.source: Details on each guideline
trans-unit.target: Details on each guideline

trans-unit.source: Use a Conversational Tone
trans-unit.target: Use a Conversational Tone

trans-unit.source: Appropriate Style:
trans-unit.target: Appropriate Style:

trans-unit.source: We want our documentation to have a conversational tone.
trans-unit.target: We want our documentation to have a conversational tone.

trans-unit.source: You should feel as though you are having a conversation with the author as you read any of our tutorials or explanations.
trans-unit.target: You should feel as though you are having a conversation with the author as you read any of our tutorials or explanations.

trans-unit.source: Your experience as a reader should be informal, conversational, and informative.
trans-unit.target: Your experience as a reader should be informal, conversational, and informative.

trans-unit.source: You should feel as though you are listening to the author explain the concepts to you.
trans-unit.target: You should feel as though you are listening to the author explain the concepts to you.

trans-unit.source: Inappropriate Style:
trans-unit.target: Inappropriate Style:

trans-unit.source: One might see the contrast between a conversational style and the style one finds with more academic treatments of technical topics.
trans-unit.target: One might see the contrast between a conversational style and the style one finds with more academic treatments of technical topics.

trans-unit.source: Those resources are very useful, but the authors have written those articles in a very different style than our documentation.
trans-unit.target: Those resources are very useful, but the authors have written those articles in a very different style than our documentation.

trans-unit.source: When one reads an academic journal, one finds a very different tone and a very different style of writing.
trans-unit.target: When one reads an academic journal, one finds a very different tone and a very different style of writing.

trans-unit.source: One feels that they are reading a dry account of a very dry topic.
trans-unit.target: One feels that they are reading a dry account of a very dry topic.

trans-unit.source: The first paragraph above follows our recommendation conversational style.
trans-unit.target: The first paragraph above follows our recommendation conversational style.

trans-unit.source: The second is a more academic style.
trans-unit.target: The second is a more academic style.

trans-unit.source: You see the difference immediately.
trans-unit.target: You see the difference immediately.

trans-unit.source: Write in 2nd person
trans-unit.target: Write in 2nd person

trans-unit.source: Appropriate Style:
trans-unit.target: Appropriate Style:

trans-unit.source: You should write your articles as though you are speaking directly to the reader.
trans-unit.target: You should write your articles as though you are speaking directly to the reader.

trans-unit.source: You should use second person often (as I just have in these two sentences).
trans-unit.target: You should use second person often (as I just have in these two sentences).

trans-unit.source: 2nd person doesn't always mean using the word 'you'.
trans-unit.target: 2nd person doesn't always mean using the word 'you'.

trans-unit.source: Write directly to the reader.
trans-unit.target: Write directly to the reader.

trans-unit.source: Write imperative sentences.
trans-unit.target: Write imperative sentences.

trans-unit.source: Tell your reader what you want them to learn.
trans-unit.target: Tell your reader what you want them to learn.

trans-unit.source: Inappropriate Style:
trans-unit.target: Inappropriate Style:

trans-unit.source: An author could also choose to write in 3rd person.
trans-unit.target: An author could also choose to write in 3rd person.

trans-unit.source: In that model, an author must find some pronoun or noun to use when referring to the reader.
trans-unit.target: In that model, an author must find some pronoun or noun to use when referring to the reader.

trans-unit.source: A reader might often find this 3rd person style less engaging and less enjoyable to read.
trans-unit.target: A reader might often find this 3rd person style less engaging and less enjoyable to read.

trans-unit.source: The first paragrah follows our recommended style.
trans-unit.target: The first paragrah follows our recommended style.

trans-unit.source: The second uses 3rd person.
trans-unit.target: The second uses 3rd person.

trans-unit.source: Please write in second person.
trans-unit.target: Please write in second person.

trans-unit.source: You probably found that much easier to read.
trans-unit.target: You probably found that much easier to read.

trans-unit.source: Use Active Voice
trans-unit.target: Use Active Voice

trans-unit.source: Write your articles in active voice.
trans-unit.target: Write your articles in active voice.

trans-unit.source: Active voice means that the subject of the sentence performs the action (verb) of that sentence.
trans-unit.target: Active voice means that the subject of the sentence performs the action (verb) of that sentence.

trans-unit.source: It contrasts with passive voice, where the sentence is arranged such that the subject of the sentence is acted upon.
trans-unit.target: It contrasts with passive voice, where the sentence is arranged such that the subject of the sentence is acted upon.

trans-unit.source: Constrast these two examples:
trans-unit.target: Constrast these two examples:

trans-unit.source: The compiler transformed source code into an executable.
trans-unit.target: The compiler transformed source code into an executable.

trans-unit.source: The source code was transformed into an executable by the compiler.
trans-unit.target: The source code was transformed into an executable by the compiler.

trans-unit.source: The first sentence uses active voice.
trans-unit.target: The first sentence uses active voice.

trans-unit.source: The second sentence was written in passive voice.
trans-unit.target: The second sentence was written in passive voice.

trans-unit.source: (Those two sentences provide another example of each style).
trans-unit.target: (Those two sentences provide another example of each style).

trans-unit.source: We recommend active voice because it is more readable.
trans-unit.target: We recommend active voice because it is more readable.

trans-unit.source: Passive voice can be more difficult to read.
trans-unit.target: Passive voice can be more difficult to read.

trans-unit.source: Target a 5th Grade Reading Level
trans-unit.target: Target a 5th Grade Reading Level

trans-unit.source: We provide this final guideline because many of our readers are not native English speakers.
trans-unit.target: We provide this final guideline because many of our readers are not native English speakers.

trans-unit.source: You are reaching an international audience with your articles.
trans-unit.target: You are reaching an international audience with your articles.

trans-unit.source: Please take into account that they may not have the English vocabulary you have.
trans-unit.target: Please take into account that they may not have the English vocabulary you have.

trans-unit.source: However, you are still writing for technical professionals.
trans-unit.target: However, you are still writing for technical professionals.

trans-unit.source: You can assume that your readers have programming knowledge and the specific vocabulary for programming terms.
trans-unit.target: You can assume that your readers have programming knowledge and the specific vocabulary for programming terms.

trans-unit.source: Object Oriented Programming, Class, and Object, Function and Method will all be familiar terms.
trans-unit.target: Object Oriented Programming, Class, and Object, Function and Method will all be familiar terms.

trans-unit.source: However, not everyone reading your articles will have a formal computer science degree.
trans-unit.target: However, not everyone reading your articles will have a formal computer science degree.

trans-unit.source: Terms like 'idempotent' probably need to be defined if you use it:
trans-unit.target: Terms like 'idempotent' probably need to be defined if you use it:

trans-unit.source: The Close() method is idempotent, meaning that you can call it multiple times and the effect is the same as if you called it once.
trans-unit.target: The Close() method is idempotent, meaning that you can call it multiple times and the effect is the same as if you called it once.
